intro: Hypocalymma angustifolium subsp. longifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in heathlands and woodland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
